item.title: Bridge collapse poses the first major challenge for Maryland Gov. Wes Moore, a Democratic rising star
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Marquez and Allan Smith and Mike Memoli
item.description: After a Baltimore bridge collapse killed six people and shut down an international port, Maryland Gov. Wes Moore has stepped into the national spotlight this week, leading the response to the tragic, unforeseen catastrophe.

media:content.media:text: Maryland Gov. Wes Moore
media:content.media:description: Maryland Gov. Wes Moore on March 28, 2024, in Baltimore.

media:content.media:text: Wes Moore speaks during a news conference.
media:content.media:description: Maryland Gov. Wes Moore at a news conference near the scene where a container ship collided with a support on the Francis Scott Key Bridge, in Dundalk, Md., on March 26, 2024.

media:content.media:text: Democratic Primary debate for Maryland governor candidates
media:content.media:description: A Democratic primary debate for Maryland governor in 2022.

media:content.media:text: Andy Beshear
media:content.media:description: Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear in Frankfort, Ky., on March 26.

item.title: AT&T investigating leak that dumped millions of customers’ data on dark web
item.dc:creator: Minyvonne Burke and Joe Kottke
item.description: AT&T is investigating a leak earlier this month that dumped millions of customers' data, including personal information such as Social Security numbers, on the dark web.

media:content.media:text: AT&T logo
media:content.media:description: AT&T said it is looking into whether "the data in those fields originated from AT&T or one of its vendors."

item.title: Man receives life-saving transplant after seeing NBC News story
item.description: Dr. Gary Gibbon was battling lung cancer when he saw an NBC News story on experimental transplants being carried out at Northwestern Medicine. A year later, he credits it with saving his life.

media:content.media:title: Man receives life-saving transplant after seeing NBC News story
media:content.media:description: Dr. Gary Gibbon was battling lung cancer when he saw an NBC News story on experimental transplants being carried out at Northwestern Medicine. A year later, he credits it with saving his life.

item.title: ‘I am so scared of them now’: Burned from overspending, some ‘buy now, pay later’ users warn others away
item.dc:creator: J.J. McCorvey
item.description: After racking up thousands of dollars in debt, some borrowers are deleting the apps from their phones to avoid getting prodded to spend more.

media:content.media:text: Image of a man on computer on top of a stack of boxes
media:content.media:description: Some users of buy now, pay later services have found the extent of their overspending sneaks up on them suddenly.

item.title: Ships with a second round of aid for Gaza have departed Cyprus as concerns about hunger soar
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: A three-ship convoy left a port in Cyprus on Saturday with 400 tons of food and other supplies for Gaza as concerns about hunger in the territory soar.

media:content.media:text: Displaced Palestinians gather to collect food
media:content.media:description: Displaced Palestinians gather to collect food in Rafah on March 11.

media:content.media:text: Cargo ships.
media:content.media:description: Cargo ships loaded with aid destined for Gaza prepare to set sail outside the Cypriot port of Larnaca on Saturday.

media:content.media:text: Palestinian women arrange kitchen utensils to dry atop a destroyed car at a makeshift camp for displaced people.
media:content.media:description: Palestinian women arrange kitchen utensils to dry atop a destroyed car at a makeshift camp for displaced people in Rafah on Saturday.

media:content.media:text: A displaced Palestinian girl washes kitchen utensils on the beach as fishermen sail in a boat.
media:content.media:description: A displaced Palestinian girl washes kitchen utensils on the beach as fishermen sail in a boat in Rafah on Saturday.

item.title: LSU coach Kim Mulkey responds to questions about Washington Post profile, saying she hasn’t read it
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Cohen
item.description: Kim Mulkey, the legendary Louisiana State University women's basketball coach, said twice Saturday she hadn't yet read The Washington Post's profile on her everlasting athletic career.

media:content.media:text: Head coach Kim Mulkey of the LSU Lady Tigers
media:content.media:description: LSU women's basketball head coach Kim Mulkey during the Sweet 16 round of the 2024 NCAA Tournament on Saturday in Albany, N.Y.

item.title: Chance Perdomo, actor who starred in 'Gen V,' dies after motorcycle accident at 27
item.dc:creator: Variety
item.description: Chance Perdomo, who starred in the television series "Gen V" and "Chilling Adventures of Sabrina," has died as a result of a motorcycle accident.

media:content.media:text: "Mission: Impossible - Dead Reckoning Part One" UK Premiere – VIP Access
media:content.media:description: Chance Perdomo attends a film premiere in London on June 22.
Chance Perdomo in the Netflix show "Chilling Adventures of Sabrina."

item.title: Trump exaggerates claim that many Americans are 'hostages' in Afghanistan
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Allen and Olympia Sonnier and Abigail Williams
item.description: Trump says many Americans are living in the country "probably as hostages." U.S. officials say they're trying to free two U.S. citizens currently jailed there.

media:content.media:text: Donald Trump
media:content.media:description: Donald Trump in Rome, Ga., on March 9.

item.title: Missouri teen beaten in viral video is out of ICU but has limited speech and trouble walking on her own, attorney says
item.dc:creator: Minyvonne Burke
item.description: A Missouri teenager who was brutally beaten in what officials called a "deranged display of violence" by another teen is out of the intensive care unit but has limited speech and trouble walking on her own, an attorney for the family said.

media:content.media:text: Kaylee Gain
media:content.media:description: Kaylee Gain

item.title: Passengers injured when United Airlines flight experiences severe turbulence
item.description: Seven passengers were injured when United Airlines Flight 85 from Tel Aviv to Newark, New Jersey experienced several minutes of severe turbulence due to a sudden change in wind direction. The flight was diverted to Stewart International Airport, 70 miles north of New York City. NBC News’ George Solis reports.

media:content.media:title: Passengers injured when United Airlines flight experiences severe turbulence
media:content.media:description: Seven passengers were injured when United Airlines Flight 85 from Tel Aviv to Newark, New Jersey experienced several minutes of severe turbulence due to a sudden change in wind direction. The flight was diverted to Stewart International Airport, 70 miles north of New York City. NBC News’ George Solis reports.

item.title: U.S. business leaders meet with China’s president as Beijing seeks closer ties
item.description: NBC News' Janis Mackey Frayer reports from Beijing, where a number of U.S. business leaders, including the CEOs of Blackstone, Qualcomm, Bloomberg, Chubb and FedEx, met with the Chinese president

media:content.media:title: U.S. business leaders meet with China’s president as Beijing seeks closer ties
media:content.media:description: NBC News' Janis Mackey Frayer reports from Beijing, where a number of U.S. business leaders, including the CEOs of Blackstone, Qualcomm, Bloomberg, Chubb and FedEx, met with the Chinese president

item.title: Crews start removing first piece of twisted steel from collapsed Baltimore bridge
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: Teams of engineers worked Saturday on the intricate process of cutting and lifting the first section of twisted steel from the collapsed Francis Scott Key Bridge, which crumpled into the Patapsco River this week after a massive cargo ship crashed into one of its supports.

media:content.media:text: Crews work on the Francis Scott Key Bridge on March 30, 2024.
media:content.media:description: Crews work on the Francis Scott Key Bridge on March 30, 2024.

item.title: LSU coach Kim Mulkey responds to questions about Washington Post profile, saying she hasn’t read it
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Cohen
item.description: Kim Mulkey, the legendary Louisiana State University women's basketball coach, said twice Saturday she hadn't yet read The Washington Post's profile on her everlasting athletic career.

media:content.media:text: Head coach Kim Mulkey of the LSU Lady Tigers
media:content.media:description: LSU women's basketball head coach Kim Mulkey during the Sweet 16 round of the 2024 NCAA Tournament on Saturday in Albany, N.Y.

item.title: Port of Baltimore workers were bracing for a busy summer season. Now thousands face an uncertain future.
item.dc:creator: Julia Jester
item.description: The livelihoods of thousands of workers who process goods passing through the Port of Baltimore hang in the balance as cargo shipments grind to a halt after a container ship crashed into the Francis Scott Key Bridge this week.

media:content.media:text: The collapsed Francis Scott Key Bridge.
media:content.media:description: The collapsed Francis Scott Key Bridge in Baltimore on March 27.

item.title: Lizzo says she's tired of being 'dragged by everyone' on the internet: 'I QUIT'
item.dc:creator: Samantha Kubota, TODAY
item.description: Lizzo announced Friday that she is quitting the music business because she is "tired of putting up with being dragged by everyone in my life and on the internet.”

media:content.media:text: Lizzo
media:content.media:description: Lizzo in Beverly Hills, Calif., on March 10.

item.title: As some countries spurn cars, the U.S. continues to embrace highways
item.dc:creator: Mike Gagliardi
item.description: The U.S. continues to fund and expand highways, even as some parts of the world invest in greener infrastructure over concerns about global warming and amid a broader movement away from cars.

media:content.media:text: MacArthur Freeway Maze aerial
media:content.media:description: An aerial view of afternoon traffic driving along the MacArthur Maze in Oakland, Calif., in 2023.

item.title: Zelenskyy fires more aides in a reshuffle as Russia launches drones and missiles across Ukraine
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy dismissed a longtime aide and several advisers on Saturday in a continuing reshuffle while Russia unleashed fresh attacks overnight.

media:content.media:text: Image:
media:content.media:description: A Ukrainian soldier rests in a trench on the front line in the Donetsk region of Ukraine on Friday.

item.title: Hawaii’s biggest hula festival is honoring Lahaina wildfire victims this year
item.dc:creator: Katherine Itoh
item.description: The Merrie Monarch Festival, a weeklong cultural event in Hilo, Hawaii features the best hālau hula, or hula schools, from across the country.

media:content.media:text: The annual Merrie Monarch Hula Festival
media:content.media:description: The annual Merrie Monarch Hula Festival in Hilo, Hawaii.

media:content.media:description: Hula teacher Manu Boyd chants at the annual Merrie Monarch Hula Festival in Hilo, Hawaii, in 2007.

item.title: Three U.N. observers and a translator wounded in south Lebanon, peacekeeping mission says
item.dc:creator: Reuters and Aurora Almendral
item.description: An strike on Saturday hit a vehicle carrying United Nations technical observers outside the southern Lebanese border town of Rmeish, wounding several observers, two security sources told Reuters, who attriubted the strike to Israel.

item.title: A family is searching for answers after a pregnant mother was found dead in a Kansas City park
item.dc:creator: Deon J. Hampton
item.description: The family of Elaysha Gilliam, a pregnant mother of four found dead in Kansas City, Missouri, wants to know why the police investigation has stalled.

media:content.media:description: Elaysha Gilliam.
